reviewText: What a joy to learn so much about tracing our roots and finding where we have really descended from.  How rich a heritage.  Greatful for it and you will be too!!!
I enjoyed watching some of this on TV, so I bought it to see  in its intirety. Excellent for all. Great salesmanship. Would do business with again. A+++++++++++

I decided to have a DNA test after viewing this video, it was very exciting to watch the program's participants discover information about their families...I have been inspired by this video to research my family.

Wow! It's kind of creepy, but it will make you want to follow your roots.
Honestly, I'm not sure that I would want to know!!!

After 40 years of knowing that I was an American of Scottish descent with the looks and the family tree to substantiate it, my sister unveils that I (we) are one-quarter French! What a shock and also a pleasant surprise. I don't look the least bit French, but suddenly in one minute,I am! How does this change my perspective on myself? Well, can you imagine having been certain all your life that you were African-American and part Indian only to find out that you are actually more white than you are either of the other two strains of humanity? I must say, that PBS has outdone itself this time! African American Lives,Part One was good, but the ongoing saga/sequel is stupendous. I was captivated for 4 hours (and that is tough for me!) with the indepth look into the racial makeup of such well known people as Olympic Gold Medalist Jackie Joyner-Kersee,The Shawshank Redemption (Two-Disc Special Edition)'s Morgan Freeman, Hotel Rwanda's Don Cheadle and others whose backgrounds are shown to them through the latest technological advances in DNA testing. Not only were the twelve African-Americans involved in this documentary,who have always identified themselves as such, surprised,amazed,moved and aghast at the findings,but they are asked to either reject or embrace what they discover about their lineage. As I will never see myself as pure Scottish ever again, neither will the likes of Linda Hamilton Rice,Tina Turner,Tom Joyner. Bliss Brysen,Rev. Gomes and Henry Gates ( I have missed someone else-oops!).If this PBS Special fails to win an Award for something, than I will give up on Award Shows altogether!

If you have followed the PBS 4 hour mini-series "African American Lives 2" this February, then you will want to purchase the DVD I am certain. This amazingly well documented and directed expose of 12 "black" people, including the likes of Pop Diva Icon Tina Turner,comedian Chris Rock,everybody's favorite narrator Morgan Freeman,actor Don Cheadle as well as historians,preachers and Harvard Professors,whose racial identity is disclosed to them through court documents,wills,ship manifests and the newest advances in DNA technology yielding surprises beyond belief to them as well as myself!!! Who we are is simply not that easy to say. Where we come from is not as simple as black or white. What is being "black" anyway? What is being "white"? What do you do with information when culture tells you that you are one "race", but DNA tells you either way more or the opposite? These are the complex questions that are answered in great detail for these 12 people,identified as "black" or "African-American." (Frankly, this is so interesting that any "race" will benefit immensely from this documentary film!) This documentary brilliantly is non-biased and quite moving. See how Don Cheadle reacts when he finds that his family was owned by Native Americans!!!! Tina Turner is one third European and NO Native American blood! Chris Rock is 1/5 "white"! There is even the authoress Briss Bryson who has always been "white" who discovers that she has more African blood than most "negroes"!!!! What do we do with such information? Does it change who we are,or does it complete who we are? Henry Gates,Harvard Professor is 50% Irish, and yet has always identified as "African." African-American Radio personality Tom Joyner is overwhelmed when he sees a painting of his 5th-great grandfather, a white Supreme Court Judge who has the exact same grey eyes. This stuff is overwhelming! Lots of myths are dispelled about certain long held beliefs about slavery. Others are confirmed. Did all blacks come from slavery? No. Did "free blacks" live in the Old South-overwhelmingly! Anyone interested in their heritage, whatever it may be, will be touched and challenged to dig into their past and ask questions about whence they came. Will what you find,though, affect where you are going? A fascinating companion film to this would be Frontline By PBS ; Jefferson's Blood, and African American Lives.I cannot give a higher recommendation for purchase than this documentary. LOOK FOR THIS TO AIR AGAIN IN THE NEXT WEEKS ON PBS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
My class of elementary school students have enjoyed this almost as much as the class paraprofessional & myself.  Mr. Ramsey & Myself will take it home to watch again.

I've used this episode many times to help my high school students understand the successes and failures of Reconstruction. One student recently told me it was the best documentary he had ever seen! I especially like sharing Chris Rock's story and seeing his reaction to learning about his family.

I really enjoyed this.  So many wonderful stories and history.  Actually this contains mind blowing information.  Please watch it an pass it on to others.  Don't forget to watch the first one as this is part two.
Wonderful true and hidden stories realized for these celebraties' families. This video is packed with our history in this country.
I loved these two movies and my students really got quiet and listened to this. It was very much needed.

this was interesting and unbelievable how far back some can go ,i enjoyed watching it,and was glad for the participants to have gone so far back
catherine fletcher

I have seen most of the Henry Louis Gates,Jr. DVDs and they are all excellent. This is one of his best.
Morgan Freeman is one of my favorite actors. I have all three of his Through the Wormhole science DVDs and watched them many times. Chris Rock, Tina Turner and 8 others add a lot to the 240 minute program. Highly recommended.
This is another great video to show the history of America that is being omitted from the history books!

This is a must-see movie for everyone.  It highlights 9 African-American celebrities, who's face we see in movies, television, and hear in music, as well as people who're not in the public eye as much.  A revealing look into the past of so many prominent people of our day.
Beautifully done!  Very Detailed. It inspired some of my family to get their DNA done.  We were not surprised at the results.  Somehow  we knew all along!
What a joy to learn so much about tracing our roots and finding where we have really descended from.  How rich a heritage.  Greatful for it and you will be too!!!
I enjoyed watching some of this on TV, so I bought it to see  in its intirety. Excellent for all. Great salesmanship. Would do business with again. A+++++++++++

great
Excellent Product!

Fascinating.  I have some white acquaintances who should watch this.  It's wonderful that people whose ancestors were forced to leave Africa could pinpoint where they lived so precisely through a combination of DNA and historical records.  The stories are interesting and touching.  My husband and I have watched the "African-American Lives" DVD's a few times already.  (We already know where our ancestors lived -- one of the perks of being white in the USA, I guess.)
To me, this DVD was like being a kid in a candy store. You want to know more and more. Such great revelations unfold. Their personal stories complement our our places in history
Love it
loved it
This is a must see for everyone very well documented.
truly amazing
Watch & learn.
I first saw this series on PBS a few years ago and it was great. I really enjoyed the research and reactions of those profiled in the series. Wonderful job. I will definite buy all of the series.
